channel.title: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition
channel.description: I have ubuntu, and I created a smaller partition on my system using gparted, but whenever I try to run my windows xp installation disk it just crashes. How do I install windows xp on this partition?

item.title: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I would have this same problem when it was actually installing XP. Try burning the CD using the lowest write speed. That was my problem.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition

item.title: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Generally it’s a much more favorable idea to install Windows first before Linux if you choose to dual boot. Have you tried using different XP disks?

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition

item.title: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:7, topic:510824”][quote author=jal knight link=topic=629072.msg4269544#msg4269544 date=1364418743]

It’ll say “Starting Windows” after it loads all of the files, and boom, it crashes.

I burned (burnt?) a disc image file onto a disc, and I’m running that.

It could be a corrupt disk. Does it have any scratches? Did you torrent the OS? I’ve torrented an old copy of XP before and it was actually missing 2 VERY important .exes.
[/quote]

Yeah, but it had like 2500 seeders so I figured it’d be alright. The disc itself is fine.

Join #mopar rather than #moparscape in the IRC and ask someone, they’ll be able to help :).

If anyone can point me to an OS that they know works for sure, that’d be great.[/quote]
Try to make a new disc. I had a xUbuntu CD I made and it installed on a computer fine. I took it out of that computer and put it in another, never worked again. Could be a bad write to the CD, maybe burn it at a slower speed? Can be a number of things. That or try unetbootin, its a very bad method to startup the cd but it does work.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition

item.title: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:6, topic:510824”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=629072.msg4269540#msg4269540 date=1364418496]
It’ll say “Starting Windows” after it loads all of the files, and boom, it crashes.

I burned (burnt?) a disc image file onto a disc, and I’m running that.
[/quote]

It could be a corrupt disk. Does it have any scratches? Did you torrent the OS? I’ve torrented an old copy of XP before and it was actually missing 2 VERY important .exes.[/quote]

Yeah, but it had like 2500 seeders so I figured it’d be alright. The disc itself is fine.

Ruby:

Join #mopar rather than #moparscape in the IRC and ask someone, they’ll be able to help :).

If anyone can point me to an OS that they know works for sure, that’d be great.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Windows XP from Ubuntu onto another partition
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:3, topic:510824”]It’ll say “Starting Windows” after it loads all of the files, and boom, it crashes.

I burned (burnt?) a disc image file onto a disc, and I’m running that.[/quote]

It could be a corrupt disk. Does it have any scratches? Did you torrent the OS? I’ve torrented an old copy of XP before and it was actually missing 2 VERY important .exes.

Read full topic
